title: Kim Kardashian carries son Psalm him to his baptism in Armenia
text:
She's been excitedly sharing details of her trip back to her family's ancestral land of Armenia since touching down in the capital city of Yerevan.

And on Monday afternoon, Kim Kardashian took to her Instagram story to upload a tender moment with her four-month-old baby son Psalm ahead of his baptism.

The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star, 38, was seen lovingly cradling her youngest offspring as she took him to church for his traditional ceremony.

Tender moment: Kim Kardashian took to her Instagram story to upload a tender moment with her four-month-old baby son Psalm ahead of his baptism in Yerevan, Armenia, on Monday

Mother-of-four Kim looked sensational in a clingy grey maxi dress, which featured a high neckline and was teamed with a pair of sandals.

Saint was appropriately dressed for the occasion, wearing an all-white ensemble, as is customary in Armenian culture for whoever is getting baptised.

Kim's eldest two children – daughter North, six, and son Saint, three – were seen walking beside their mother in traditional cream robes, while her second-youngest offspring Chicago, 20 months, looked adorable in a pristine white dress.

Doting mother: The Keeping Up With The Kardashians star, 38, was seen lovingly cradling her youngest offspring as she took him to church for his traditional ceremony

Cute: The bombshell took to Instagram to share a clip of herself heading to church with her youngest child

The reality star and businesswoman's three youngest children were expected to get baptised at the ceremony, which was attended by her sister Kourtney Kardashian.

Wearing a white ensemble, 41-year-old Kourtney took her own brood – Mason, nine, Penelope, seven, and Reign, four – along with her.

In April 2015, make-up mogul Kim and her husband Kanye West, 42, baptised their eldest daughter North into the Armenian Apostolic Church in Jerusalem, which was held at a 12th Century church within the walls of the Old City.

A baptism or christening serves as a symbol of purification and admission to the Christian Church. In Armenian culture, those being baptised traditionally wear white.

The Vogue coverstar is expected to discuss her beauty empire at the event, after recently hinting she's planning to produce her shapewear brand SKIMS in her ancestors' homeland.

Tender moments: In April 2015, make-up mogul Kim and her husband Kanye West, 42, baptised their eldest daughter North into the Armenian Apostolic Church in Jerusalem (pictured)

The event - held between Sunday and Wednesday - sees the world’s leading academics, technologists and entrepreneurs host sessions on technological advancements, as well as artificial intelligence, virtual reality, cybersecurity and climate change.

This year's WCIT follows the theme The Power of Decentralization: Promise and Peril.

The convention aims to explore the positive and negative impact of information and communication technology on profits and prosperity, safety and security, democracy and humanity.

Just a day before, the group were seen making their way to the St. Hovhannes-Mkrtich Church of the Mother See of Holy Etchmiadzin.

Excited: Feeling giddy about her trip, the entrepreneur tweeted: 'Almost 3 am in Armenia and I can’t sleep I’m so excited to be here and see everyone!'

'I have big plans': The mother-of-four revealed her plans to produce her shapewear range, SKIMS, in Armenia last month

Kim is also set to attend the World Congress on Information Technology (WCIT) event, four years after her first visit to Armenia.

Feeling giddy about her trip, Kim - whose family fled the country and relocated to in the early 20th century - tweeted: 'Almost 3 am in Armenia and I can’t sleep I’m so excited to be here and see everyone!'

In April 2015, Kim visited Armenia with sister Khloe, 35, mother Kris Jenner, 63, husband Kanye and their daughter North.

During their visit, the reality stars laid red tulips at the memorial commemorating the victims of the Armenian genocide 100 years ago.

The group visited the eternal flame of the Armenian Genocide Memorial Complex on the outskirts of Yerevan as part of an eight-day tour of the country.

Proud: Documenting her trip, the Los Angeles native shared a snap of the Armenian flag from her hotel room
description: She's been excitedly sharing details of her trip back to her family's ancestral land of Armenia since touching down in the capital city of Yerevan.
